instruction.__text: face the octagon carpet. move until you see red brick floor to your right. turn and walk down the red brick until you get to an alley with grey floor. you should be two alleys away from a lamp and then an easel beyond that.
from one turn until you see a corner of blue carpet in a side alley.  move there. turn left. move to the second alley. you should see gray floor to your right and a chair in front of you.
Take the yellow path all the way to the end of the hall until you can only either go right or left.  There will be black easel here.  This is position 2.

turn to face the green hallway. walk forward twice. turn left. you should be facing the red hallway. walk forward once
        .

face the octagon carpet. move forward one alley to the wooden flooring. turn left. walk along the wooden floor until you see red brick floor. at this intersection look for flowered carpet and an easel. move to the easel. this is 1.
take the green path to the red brick intersection. go right onto the red brick towards the lamp. one intersection past the lamp is 7.
follow the wood path towards red brick path intersection. take a left onto the red brick towards the lamp. on intersection past the lamp will be 7.

take the wood path towards the chair. at the red brick intersection, take a left. at the second intersection down, take a right. at the end of this hall, you can either only go right or left. this is 3.

Face toward the longer end of the brick hall. The chair should be behind. There should be butterfly pcitures on the walls to your left and Eiffel tower pictures on the walls to your right.  Go forward four segments down the brick hallway, passing a lamp and an easel to the grassy hallway. Turn right at the hatrack contained in this intersection. Go forward two segments to the intersection of the grassy hall and the yellow-tiled hall.  This intersection should be empty.  This is Position 4.
with your back to the sofa. move past the stool and chair to the flowered carpet. turn right. walk to the easel. this is 1.

face the chair at 6. move to it. turn left. you should see blue carpet. walk along the blue past a stool and a sofa. stop at the hat rack. turn left. move straight into the corner. this is 5
        .
look at the pictures on all of the immediate walls. turn so that the pics of towers are to your back. walk forward once.
turn so the wall is on your right and back. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward twice. turn right. walk forward once.
find the pink flowered floored area. pos 1 is on the aesal.

Follow the hall with the yellow-tiled floor to the hall with pink-flowered carpet on the floor.  Turn left into this hall.  Follow this hall until you reach the hall with a brown stone floor,one previous to the blue-tiled hall. Turn left. Follow the hall until you reach a concrete hall with butterflies to the side the blue tile is on, the right side, and nothing in the intersection at that end of the hall. The intersection you are standing in should also be empty. This is position 7.
go straight on the plain cement path. the very first intersection will be position 7.

face the hat rack and move to it. turn right. move one alley past the chair and turn right. move one alley. to the left and right you should see flowered carpet. this is seven
        .
take one movement towards the blue corridor. and stop. that's it.
taek the brick path towards the lamp. take a right on the plain path two intersections after the lamp. at the end where you can only go right or left onto a blue path, you are at 3.

Stand with your back to the wall of the 'T' intersection.  Turn to the left into the wooden-floored hallway. One segment down this hall, a brick -floored hallway intersects it. Turn left into this hallway. Follow this hallway until you reach the bare concrete hall one segment away from the last intersection, which contains a chair. The walls to you left should have pictures of the Eiffel tower.  Those to your right will have butterflies. The intersection to your right will be vacant, though blue tile will be visible to each side. This is position 7.
        .
take a right down the blue corridor. then go left. and then take another left once you see a coatrack in the middle of the hall.

Go toward the hatrack. Turn left at the hatrack into the blue-tiled hall. Go forward until you reach an intersection with wooden flooring to your right.  Turn right in this hall. Postion 6 will be either one segment before or one segment after the segment with the lamp and will be empty.

go towards the coat rack. at the blue path intersection, hang a left. the second intersection down will be position 2. at this intersection, however, you can either only go straight or right onto a plain cement path.

turn to face the long red hallway. go to the end. turn right. go to the end. you should end up at the intersection of yellow and green
        .
three is at the intersection of the long blue floored buterfly walled and the hallway with no furniture.
two is on an aesal, not in the pink floored area, the other one.

Face away from the shorter end of the hall. the blue-tiled hallway should be visible to your right. Follow the brown brick floored hallway to the wooden floored hallway. Turn left toward the yellow hexagonal tiled hallway.  Follow the wooden floored hallway to the 'T' intersection where the top of the 'T' is two sections of wooden floor and the stem of the 'T' is a yellow hexagonally tiled section. This is Position 6.
find the aesal in the fish area with black floors near it.

take the red brick road away from the lamp to the green path intersection. take a right onto the green path all the way to the end of the hall where the green and yellow paths meet in a corner. this is 4.

Orient yourself along the bare concrete hall,facing the blue-tiled hallway. You should see butterflies on the walls ahead of you.  There should be a chair in the interection to your left.  Go forward one segment to the blue-tiled hall. Turn left. Go forward two segments, passing the bench. Turn left at the hatrack into the bare concrete hall. Go forward one segment. This is Position 5.
take the wood path towards the red brick intersection. once here, take a right onto the red brick and follow it until the intersection with red brick and plain cement. this is 7.
go straight. then right. then all the way down until you get to where the yellow and grey halls intersect, with an easel.

go down 1 block.  turn left. keep going, looking  down each of the streets on the right, until you see the street with no furniture do not go down it. stay on the butterfly street. the T intersection is the position 3. you should see blue on the floors perpendicular to the street w/ no furniture.

this one is a little tricky to get oriented. look at the closest pictures on the walls for each hallway. turn so that you are facing the butterflys, and the towers are on the walls behind you. walk forward once. turn to the left. you should be looking at the blue hallway. walk forward twice. turn left. walk forward once.

Face the shorter portion of the brick hall. There should be a hatrack in the intersection you are facing and a lamp in the intersection behind you. Go forward one segment to the grassy hall. Turn right. Go forward two segments to the intersection of the yellow-tiled hall. This is Position 4.
Go down the grassy hallway one segment to the bare concrete hall. Turn left. Go forward three segements to the 'T' intersection with the stone floor. This is Position 6.
turn so that the walls are on your right and back. walk forward once. turn right and walk forward twice.
take a left. take the blue hall to the grassy hall. then the grassy hall to the yellow hall until they intersect.
take the yellow path to the pink path intersection. go right onto the pink path all the way to the black easel. at this intersection of pink path and red brick, you are at position 1.
take the yellow path all the way to the end of the hall where the corner brings the yellow and green path together. this is 4.

Go toward the bench at the end of the hall with pink-flowered carpet. Turn right at the bench into the yellow tiled hall. Go two segments to the intesection with the stone-floored hallway. This intersection contains an easel.  This is Position 2.

Place your back against the wall of the 'T' intersection. Follow the stone hall to your left three segments to the blue-tiled hallway.  Turn left at the stool in the blue-tiled hall. Follow this hall past the bench to the hatrack, about four segments. Turn left into the bare concrete floored hall whose intersection with the blue-tiled hall contains the hatrack. Go forward one segment to the corner.  This is Position 5.

with your back to the wall move forward until the brick alley is to your left and right. turn right and move one alley. this is 7
        .

at two place your back to the wall. turn right. walk to the corner. at your left you should see grass. this is 4
        .
down blue hall till you hit the grassy hall. down the grassy hall till you hit the yellow hall. down the yellow hall until it intersects with the grey hall and has an easel.
at seven face the chair. turn right. move to the blue carpet. you should see a sofa to your left and a stool two alleys to your right. this is 3.

with your back to the wall move forward to the wall. turn right and you see grass carpet in front of you and green octagon carpet down the next alley. move to this spot. this is four
        .
take the yellow path all the way down to the wood path intersection. here, take a right onto the wood path. go to the intersection of plain cement and wood path. this is position 6.
go down the red hall until you see the blue hall. at that intersection stop.
position two is at the aesal in the area between two black floors and one green floor.

Face the shorter portion of the pink-flowered carpet hall, where it interesects the blue-tiled hall. Your back should be away from the bench at the opposite end, where the pink-flowered carpet hall meets the yellow-tiled hall two segments away. Go forward one segment to the blue-tiled hall. Turn left into the blue-tiled hall. Go forward three segments, past the stool, to the intersection of the bare concrete hall. There should be a bench and a hatrack ahead of you in the blue-tiled hall and no objects in either of the intersections to your left. This is Position 3
        .
turn to face the walls with the immediate tower pictures. walk forward once. turn left. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward once.
take the pink path towards the wood path. at the wood path intersection, take the wood path towards the eiffel towers on the walls. at the intersection with the plain cement, you'll be at 6.
go all the way straight down the hall.
go down the butterfly walled/blue floored hallway. make a left at the hatrack.

turn so that the wall is on your right and back. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward three times. turn right to face the black hallway. walk forward three times. if you are in the right place you should be at the intersection of black and yellow
        .
it's at the corner of the yellow floor and the grass floor.
move to the hat rack and turn right. walk down to the end of the blue carpet. turn right. walk along the grass carpet to the wall. to your right should be green octagon flooring. this is 4.
it's at the intersection of the yellow and grey halls, with an easel.
one space forward. a left at the blue hall. then two spaces forward. and a right when you see the red hall. then stop.
go straight. turn right at the rose hallway. keep going until it intersects with the red hallway and has an easel.

Face the intersection containing the hatrack. Go forward one segment, to the blue-tiled hall. Turn right at the hatrack, Go forward two segments, passing the bench, to the empty intersection. This is Position 3.

turn so that the wall is on your left. walk forward twice. you should be at the intersection of blue and brown. turn right. walk forward twice. if there is a solid wall on your right then you are at position 6.
turn so the wall is on your left. walk forward once. turn left. walk forward twice.
Go down the hall with yellow stone floors until you come to a hall to your left with pink-flowered carpet. Turn left into this hall. Position one is the intersection containing an easel.
at six place your back to the wall. the next side alley should be flowered carpet. move to it. turn left or right to locate the easel. move to it. the side alleys are red brick. this is 1.
go towards the easel on the red brick road. take a right at the black road intersection and follow it until you come to a black easel. this is 2.

Face toward the longer portion of the brick hall. The intersection with the blue-tiled hall should be to your left; the section containing the chair behind you. Go forward two segments to the wooden hall.  Turn right. Go forward one segment to the 'T' intersection with the bare concrete hall.  This is Position 6.
turn to face the long red hallway. you should be able to see a painting easel in the far distance... walk forward three times and stop.
turn so the walls are on your right and back. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward five times. turn onto the pink hallway and walk forward once.
You will follow the regular concrete path toward the blue tiled flooring one segment.  This 'T' intersection is position 3.
Go towards the chair at the end of the hall. next, take a right and follow the path until you reach a black easel, this is position 2.
with your back to the wall turn right. you see a sofa and then a hat rack. move to the hat rack and turn left. move to the corner you see in front of you.
turn to face the green hallway. walk forward twice. turn left. walk forward four times.

Go down the blue-tiled floor until you reach a hall with pink-flowered carpet. Turn right into this hall. Follow this hall until you reach a hall with yellow stone flooring. I believe you turn right. Regardless you will turn toward the easel. The space containing the easel is position 2.
        .

face the green carpeting. move to the wall and turn left. move along the blue carpeting until you get to wooden flooring. turn left. move forward one alley. you should see gray floor to your right
        .

take the black path towards the red brick intersection. at the red brick intersection, go right towards the lamp. at the first intersection after the lamp, take a right onto the plain cement path. the next intersection will be three where the plain cement meets the blue path.
take the grassy hall to the blue hall. then the blue hall almost all the way down. then left to the red hall oine movement.

with your back to the wall at 2 turn right. at the end of the aisle you should see grass carpet to your left. walk down this. at the end of the grass alley turn right. you should see blue carpet. walk to the fourth alley where there is gray carpet on the  left alley.

Place your back to the 'T' intersection. Go forward along the bare concrete hal one segment ti the intersection of the hall of pink-flowered carpet. Turn left. Go forward one segment to the intersection of the pink-flowered carpet hall and the brick hall. There is an easel in this intersection. This is Position 1.

Orient yourself to face the hall with brown brick. Blue-tiled hall should be to your left, the intersection with the chair behind you. Go forward in the brown brick-floored hall until you reach  the intersection with the hall with the pink-flowered carpet.  This will contain an easel. This intersection is Position 1.

Face the hatrack in the blue-tiled hallway.  Walk the one segment toward it. Turn right. Follow the blue-tiled hallway to the grass floored hallway at the far end.  Turn right.  Where this hall intersects the yellow-tiled hall, there should be an empty intersection.  This is Position 4.

Face toward the hatrack in the blue-tiled hall. Go to it one segment. Turn right. Go forward two segments, or to the first empty intersection. Turn right.  The floor should be bare concrete. The walls have butterflies. Pass through this segment to the intersection with the hall of brown brick. This intersection should be empty and is Position 7.
position one is in the pink floored area, on the aesal.

Place your back against the wall of the 'T' intersection. Turn left down the stone floored hallway. Follow this hallway three segments to  the blue-tiled hallway. Turn left in this hall. You will be turning toward many pictures of butterflies.  There should be no visible pictures of fish. Follow the hallway until you reach the about second intersection with a bare concrete floor. The intersection should be empty, though the next intersection will contain a bench and the one following will contain a hatrack. The intersection to your left should be empty. The first segment of this bar concrete hall to your left should have butterfly pictures; followed by a second segment containg Eiffel Tower pictures. The hallway should 'T' after the segment of Eiffel tower pics.
it's at the corner of the yellow floor and the grassy floor.
face the hat rack and move to it. turn right. walk one alley past the chair. you should see gray floor to your right and a stool in front of you.
foward one space. then a left down the red hall until it intersects with the rose hall and has an easel.

turn to face the long red hallway. walk forward once. turn left. walk forward once
        .
go towards the lamp on the red brick road, take a right onto the wood path.  when you come to the intersection with the plain cement path, you are at position 6.
position one is at the red floors and rose floors intersection. where an easel is.
take the black path towards the pink flowered path intersection.  once here, go right onto the pink path until you reach a black easel. this is 1.
take the black path towards the intersection with the red brick path. go right onto the red brick path towards the lamp. the second intersection after the lamp will be position 7.

turn so that the wall is on your right and back. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward six times. you should be at the end of the hallway. turn right. walk forward four times. you should be at the end of the hallway again.
take a right down the blue hall until you see a coat rack. then take an immediate left.
turn so the wall is on your left. walk forward three times. turn left. walk forward once.
with your back to the wall move forward along the octagon carpet one alley. turn left. you should be facing wood flooring. move one alley. to your left is gray floor.

Place your back against the wall of the 'T' intersection. Turn right into the wooden hall. Go forward one segment to the yellow-tiled hall. Turn left. Go forward two segments, past the bench, to the intersection of the yellow-tiled and grassy halls. This is Position 4.

Place your back against the wall of the 'T' intersection. Turn to the left. Go forward two segments along the blue-tiled hall. Turn right into the wooden hall. Go forward two segments to the intersection of the bare concrete hallway. This is Position 6.

take the wood path towards the red brick intersection. go left onto the red brick. go towards the lamp to the end of the hall. at the chair at the end of the hall, go right. at the black bench, take a left onto the blue path. and then another left at the coat rack. at the end of this hall at the corner, you are at position 5.
turn to face the yellow hallway. walk forward twice. turn onto the pink hallway. walk forward once.
turn to face the yellow hallway. walk forward three times. turn onto the blue hallway. walk forward four times.
5 is at the end of the long butterlfy hallway. make a left one street before the end. you should be able to face the hat rack, behind which should be a wall, not a hallway.
follow the plain cement towards the blue path intersection. this will be position 3.
at one face the lamp. move one square. the lamp should still be in front of you. this is 7.

from four face the grass carpet and move to the hat rack. turn left and move onto the blue carpet. walk past two chairs and to the lamp. turn left. move into the corner such that the lamp is behind you and to your right you see a gray carpeted alley
        .
go straight. then turn when you see the red hall. then go down the red hall until you can look to the right and see a blue corridor.

turn so the wall is on your right. walk forward twice. turn left. walk forward once
        .
turn so the wall is on your left. walk forward once. turn left. walk forward once.

with your back to the wall move to the end of the rock floor alley. to your left and right should be blue carpet. turn left. move past the stool to the alley before the sofa. turn right you should see gray floor with the red brick on the next alley. move to where the red brick alley is on your right and left. this is 7.
yellow hall to blue hall. all the way down until one space before you see a bench.
three is in the long butterfly hallway, with blue floors. at the intersection where the street with no furniture is at.

Place your back to the wall of the 'T' intersection. Turn to the left. Go forward four segments, passing the stool and chair, to the grassy hallway.  Turn right. Go forward three segments to the intersection of the grassy and yellow-tiled hallways, passing the hatrack.  This is Position 4.
go to the pink flowered floored area. it is at the aesal.
take the blue path towards the black bench. at the coat rack take a left. the end of this hall is 5.
go all the way down the blue floor until you see a coat rack. then take an immediate left.
go to the aesal in the pink floored area.

turn to face the long red hallway. walk forward twice. turn left. walk forward twice
        .
go forward one movement in the direction of the red floor.
with your back to the wall at three move forward one alley. you should see red brick to your right and left and a lamp two alleys over to your left and an easel beyond that. this is 7.
turn to face the yellow hallway. walk forward once. turn left. walk forward once.

take the green path to the red brick intersection. go left towards the lamp to the very end of the hall. at the chair, take a right. at the blue path intersection, take a left onto the blue path. at the coat rack, take another left onto the plain cement. at the end of this hall at the corner, you are at position 5
        .

Stand with your back to the wall of the 'T' intersection. Go to the right, toward the hall with the yellow hexagonal tile floor. Position 2 is the intersection containing the easel. I believe it is to your right.
go all the way down the blue hall. then find where the wooden floor and the yellow floor doesn't quite intersect. but one movement forward and it will.
go left. then stop when you look to the right and see a blue corridor.
pos one is in the area with the pink floors, on the aesal.

take the red brick path towards the chair. here, at the end of the hall, take a right to the blue path. at the blue path, take a left towards the coat rack. at the coat rack, take a right onto the plain cement path. at the end of the hall in the corner, you are at position 5.
turn so the wall is on your left. walk forward four times. turn right. walk forward three times or until you are at the intersection of green and yellow.

turn to face the green halllway. walk three times forward. turn left. walk forward six times. turn left. walk forward once
        .
go foward. turn left. go down this ahllway until you see the fish ahllways. find the aesal in this area. that is pos 1.
go straight a few movements. then go to the red floor until you can look to the left and see a blue corridor.
head down toward the futon/bench. keep going. till you are at the hat rack. make a left. pos 5 is in that corner.

go left until you come to the four way intersection of the red and rose floors, with an easel.
        .

head toward the butterfly areas. find the long butterfly hallway, with perpendicular streets ending at its intersection with this ahllway. go to the intersection within which, whne you look down this street you see no furniture.

facing the long aisle turn left. walk to the blue carpet and turn right. walk down this aisle to the flowered carpet. turn right. there is an easel in front of you. walk to it. this is 1
        .
take the red brick path towards the lamp. at the black road intersection, take a left. follow the black until you meet up with a black easel. this is 2.

Face the yellow-tiled hall.  Follow it to the pink-flowered carpet hall. Turn right in to this hall. When you get to the intersection containing the easel, the perpendicular hall will have brown brick flooring, turn to the left. Follow the brown brick floored hall to the second to last intersection. The intersection in front of you should contain a chair and turn to the right. The intersection to your right should be empty, though you should see a blue-tiled hallway to either side of it. There will be pictures of butterflies on the walls in the hall to your right and pictures of the Eiffel Tower  in the hall to your left.  This is Position 7.
take the blue path all the way down to the pink path intersection. take a right onto the pink path and at the black easel, the brick path intersection, you are at 1.
pos 4 is at the corner of the grass floor and yellow floor, with fish on the walls.

take the blue path all the way to the end of the hall. at the corner here, turn right onto the green path. once again, go to the very end of the hall and at the corner of the green path and the yellow path, you are at 4.

at seven face, from looking at the long alley turn left. move to the blue carpet. turn left.  you should see a chair and then a hat rack. move to the hat rack. turn left at the hat rack. move to the corner. you should see gray floor to your right.

turn so that the wall is on your right and back. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward maybe four times and you should be at the intersection of blue and brown. turn right. walk forward twice. if there is a wall on your right side then you are there.
find the blue hall. go all the way down until you hit a spot with a coat rack. then tke one movement to the left.

move forward to the hat rack and turn right. move along the blue carpet past the sofa stool and chair til the alley with the flowered carpet. turn right. move forward one alley. you should be in the same square as an easel. this is 1.
turn so the wall is on your back. walk forward once. turn left. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward twice.

Follow the blue-tiled hallway away form the bench and hatrack toward the pictures of not-butterflies. I believe they are those lovely yellow fish. Turn right into the hall with pink-flowered carpet.  Position 1 is the intersection containing the easel.

Follow the grassy hall three segments to the blue-tiled hall. Turn left. Follow the blue-tiled hall six segments, passing the chair, stool and bench, to the intersection containing the hatrack. Turn left. Go one segment forward to the corner. This is Position 5.
        .

at four face the octagon carpet. move to the end . you should be in the same square as an easel and rock flooring to your right and left. this is 2
        .

take the yellow path to the wood path intersection. here, go left onto the wood path. when you reach an intersection with plain cement and their are eiffel towers on the walls of the wood path and fish on the walls of the plain path, you are at 6.

Go three segments down the grassy hall to the blue-tiled hall, passing the hatrack. Turn left into the blue-tiled hall. Follow it four segments to the intersection with the bare concrete hall, passing the chair and stool. This is Position 3.
turn so the wall is on your back. walk forward once.

from four face the octagon carpet and move forward one alley. turn right. you should be facing flowered carpet and an easel. move to it. this is 1
        .

take the path straight with the fish on the walls. go all the way to the end of the hall. you should meet here with the green path. go right onto the green path to the end of the hall. at the corner, you are at 4.
blue hall to grassy hall. grassy hall to yellow hall. yellow hall to wooden hall. then one space forward.

position three is located in the butterfly area.
        .
turn so that the wall is on your back. walk forward once. turn left. walk forward once. if you are at the intersection of red and pink and there is a painting thing, you are there.

turn to face the short red hallway. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward twice
        .
yellow hall down to the wooden floor intersection. then one movement forward.

with your back to the wall, turn right. move to the blue carpet. turn left. move past the stool until you get to the intersection where gray floor is to your right. there should be a sofa in front of you and a hat rack beyond that. this is 3.

Follow the blue path until you come to an intersection with a wood path. take the wood path to the right and follow it until you see pictures of the eiffel tower on the wall. when you get to the intersection with fish on the wall to your right, and eiffel towers on your path, this is position 6.

turn to face the pink hallway so that the painting easel is on your back left side. walk forward once. turn left. you should be facing the blue hallway. walk forward five times. turn left. walk forward once.

down the long butterfly hallway, with blue walls.  make a left at the hat rack. pos 5 is in this corner
        .
face the lamp and move to it. turn right. move to the alley with the brown wooden floor. turn right. move forward one block. this is 6.
look for a spot where the red and rose floors intersect four ways, with an easel.
grassy hall to blue hall. left. then all the way down until you get between the bench and coat rack. then stop.

with your back to the wall turn left. move forward along the rock floor to the end. turn left at the stool. move along the blue carpet past the sofa to the hat rack. turn left. move into the corner. this is 5
        .

go straight towards the coat rack. take a right onto the blue path. take the blue path all the way to the end of the hall.  once here, take a right on the green path. follow the green path all the way to the end of the hall as well. here, the green meets the yellow path and you are at position 4.

with you back to the wall turn left. walk down the blue carpet, past a stool and a chair to the end. to your right should be grass. walk down the grass. at the end of the grass there should be green octagon carpet to your right.

turn so that the wall is on your left. walk forward twice. turn left. walk forward four times. turn left. walk forward once
        .

Face toward the blue-tiled hall containing the hatrack. Go forward one segment to  the hatrack.  Turn right. Follow the blue-tiled hall five segments to the pink-flowered carpet hall. Turn right. Follow this hall one segment forward to the intersection with the brick hall. THis intersection should contain an easel.  This is Position 1.
        .

take the red brick path towards the lamp. at the end of the hall at the chair, take a right. go straight to the black bench. here, take a left onto the blue path and another left at the coat rack. the end of this hall will be 5
        .
at three put your back to the sofa and move forward towards the stool. when you get to the alley with the roack floor stop and turn right. move forward to the easel. this is 2.
take the blue hall until you get to the grassy hall. then follow the grassy hall to the end where it intersects with the yellow hall.

Go two segments down the grassy hall to the hat rack. Turn left. Go one segment forward to the intersection with the hall with pink-flowered carpet.  In this intersection is an easel.  This is Position 1.

You will walk on the brick flooring away from the shorter expanse of hallway containing  the single chair toward longer expanse of hallway containing the lamp and the easel. The square containing the easel is position 2.

Face the pink-flowered carpet hall with your back to the bench at the intersection of it and the yellow-tiled hall. The longer side of the wooden hall should be to your left, the shorter to the right. Go forward one segment to the blue-tiled hall.  Turn left in the blue-tiled hall, away from the intersection with the grassy hall. Follow the blue-tiled hall five segments, past the stool and bench, to the intersection conataining the hatrack. Turn left at this intersection. Go forward one segment. This corner is Position 5.
go all the way down the grassy hall. take a left. go all the way down the blue hall until you see a coat rack. take another immediate left.
turn so that the wall is on your back. walk forward three times or until you reach the corner of yellow and green.
turn to face the yellow hallway. walk forward twice. turn right. walk forward once.
face the long alley. move down it until you get to the wood flooring. turn right and move one block.
at one face the long brick alley. walk until you see an almost black carpet. turn left. you should see an easel. move to it. this is two.

go straight down the yellow hall until you hit a corner that intersects with the grass hall
        .
go forward. then left all the way down the blue hall. then a right at teh red hall. then pos 1 is at the four way intersection of the red hall and the rose hall, with an easel.
with your back to the wall, move forward one alley. turn right. you should see wood flooring. move one block. p 6 should have two alleys of wood floor and one of gray.
Follow the yellow-tiled hall forward three segments, passing the bench.  This corner, where the yellow-tiled hall intersects the grassy hall, is Position 4.
face and move forward to the hatrack. turn right. move far down the blue carpet to the flowered carpet. turn right you should see an easel in front of you. move there. this is 2.
Place your back against the wall of the 'T' intersection. Go forward one segment. There should be a brick floor in the hall to either side of you. This is Position 7.

go towards the coat rack. at the rack, go right onto the blue path. take the blue path all the way down to the pink path intersection. go right onto the pink path. when you reach the black easel, you are at position 1.

Place your back to the 'T' intersection. Turn to the left. Go forward two segments down the wooden hall to the chair in the blue-tiled hall, passing the lamp. Turn left. Go forward four segments, passing the bench to the intersection containing the hatrack. Turn left. Go forward one segment to the corner. This is Position 5.

Place your back against the wall of the 'T' intersection. Turn to the right. Go forward two segments, past the bench, to the intersection containing the hatrack. Turn left into the bare concrete hallway. Go forward one segment. This corner is Position 5.

take the blue path away from the black bench. you will come to an intersection with a black path. take a right onto the black path all the way down until you reach the black easel. at this easel, you are at 2.

at 4 face the grass carpet. walk to the corner and turn left. you should see blue carpet. walk along the blue carpet and you pass two objects. move to the alley where there is only gray floor to your left. in front of you is a chair. this is 3.
look for the blue hall. go all the way down until you hit a spot with a coat rack. then one movement left.

Follow the yellow-tiled hall to the hall with pink-flowered carpet.  I 90% sure that you will turn left, although I am certain that you will turn in the direction in which more hallways are visible.  This hall will end in the blue-tiled hall.
        Turn left. Position three will be an empty segment on this hallway.  The flooring of the hall intersecting it will be bare concrete.  Position 3 is previous to the hatrack, but after any other objects in the hall.

from one turn until you can see a corner of blue carpet on the side alleys. move to this. turn left. you should see a chair and a hatrack in front of you. move to the hatrack. turn left. go to the corner. this is 5.

at seven put your back to the chair. move along the red brick past the lamp to the easel. turn right. move forward to the octagon flooring. turn left. move to the wall. to your left should be grass. this is 4.

go towards the coat rack. take a right onto the blue path.  go past the black bench and all of the way down until you reach the wood path intersection. take a right onto the wood path. at the intersection with plain cement, you are at 6.
position 2 is located where the yellow floors and the grey floors intersect. there is an easel there.
turn to face the long red hallway. walk forward three tiems. turn right. walk forward once.

Take the red brick path straight towards the lamp and all the way until the end of the hall. at the intersection with the green path, take a right and again, go to the end of the hall where the corner meets with the yellow path. this is position 4.
Go forward three segments down the  yellow-tiled hall, passing the bench. There is an easel in this intersection.  This is Position 2.
turn to face the yellow hallway. walk forward three times.

go towards the coat rack. at the coat rack, take a right onto the blue path. follow the blue path to the black path intersection and go right onto the black path. go all the way down until you get to a black easel. this is 2.

from 1 face the flowered carpet with the grass carpet in the next side alley. move to the grass carpet. turn left. walk to the end of this aisle. you should then see olive green octagon carpet to your right. this is 4
        .
go all the way down the hall until you get to the end, with an easel.
turn so that the wall is on your left. walk forward twice. turn left. walk forward twice.

turn to face the long red hallway. walk forward three times
        .
turn so the wall is on your left. walk forward twice or until you reach the blue hallway. turn left. walk forward three times. turn left. walk forward once.

Go straight towards the coat rack and take a right at this junction. stay on the blue patch for about two sections.  At the third, take a right onto the white cement path. the very next intersection will be position 7.
it's at a spot between the yellow floor and the grey floor, with an easel.
follow the pink path to the red brick path intersection. take the red brick towards the butterflies on the wall. at the intersection of plain cement and red brick path, this is position 7.
go forward. then left. then straight down the bvlue hall until you get to a place in between a bench and a chair.
go all the way down the blue hall. then take a right at the grassy hall. then go all the way down the grassy hall until it intersects with the yellow hall.
take the red brick patch towards the lamp. once at the black easel, you are at 1.

take the green path to the red brick intersection. go left onto the red brick path. go towards the lamp and two intersections after the lamp, turn right and when you can only go right or left, you are at 3.
turn so the wall is on your left. walk forward three times or until you reach the pink walkway. turn right. walk forward until you rech the red walkway. there should be a painting easel there too.
turn so the wall is on your back. walk forward twice. turn right. walk forward once.
head all the way toward the butterfly hallway. keep going down it until you reach a dead end square area.  pos 5 is in the corner  to the left as you enter the square block.

Face toward the hatrack. Walk the one segment to it. Turn right in the blue-tiled hall. Go forward until you reach a hall with pink flowered carpet. Turn right. Follow this hall until it 'T's with the yellow-tiled hall. Turn right. Postion 2 is the intersection at the end of the hall containing the easel.
at seven face the long alley with a lamp and an easel in front of you. walk to the easel. you should see flowered carpet to the sides. this is 2.
turn to face the long red hallway. walk forward twice. turn right. walk forward once.

Orient yourself to face the longer portion of the brick hall. The hatrack in the brick hall should be one segment behind you. The bench at the intersection of the pink-flowered carpet  hall and the yellow-tiled hall at your left; the intersection of the blue-tiled hall the the pink-flowered carpet hall to your right.  Go forward three segments.  You are now in Position 7. There should be a bare concrete floored hall at the this intersection; pictures of butterflies in the hall to the right, leading to an empty 'T' intersection with the blue-tiled hall and pictures of the Eiffel tower leading to an empty 'T' intersection to your left.
with your back to the wall at 6 turn left. walk to the second alley. turn right. you should see an easel on dark gray carpet. walk to it. the alleys on either side should be red brick. this is p-2.
face the long red-bricked alley and move along it to the wooden flooring. turn right. move one block. this is 6.
turn so the wall is on your right. walk forward once. turn right. walk forward once.
